abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            bringing Kazakh drylands back to life. Many people living in
            Kazakh drylands struggled to sustain their livelihoods as
            growing crops and grazing cattle in the difficult
            environment was a major challenge. Drylands Management
            Project tested the viability on people, the economy and the
            environment of shifting from growing cereals to raising
            livestock. Over thirty five thousand hectares of land were
            restored and perennial fodder crops were grown. Farmers’
            incomes increased because they were able to graze more
            livestock, in the fertile lands. The project helped farmers
            to raise cattle and sell milk. The long lasting effect of
            the project was creating the enthusiasm of government and
            farmers in improving the livestock production and overall
            livelihoods of rural population in the drylands territories
            of Kazakhstan.
